page.title: 08THE OLD RECTORY
page.content: The Rectory stands about a quarter of a mile from ST Gwendolines church.The Rectory began its life as a farmhouse and also a provided accommodation for passing drovers,who were men taking their livestock to market.We know this by the line of Douglas Firs alongside the lane which marked a place to stay in the last century.It then became a school,we know this because of the rows and rows of coat pegs in the kitchen,and the ink bottles which were found in the garden.The women who owned it left the buiding to the church making all the land around it Glebeland (land of the church).As a result it became a rectory to provide accommodation for the vicar of the parish of Vaynor.Despite the rectory being so big the vicar only lived in two rooms.
